intro: Duckeella garayi, commonly known as the Ecuadorian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant is perennial and thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Duckeella garayi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
